data.title: Shahid Kapoor on toxic masculinity in Kabir Singh: The film warns you against taking that route
data.meta_description: Kabir Singh has drawn much flak for allegedly portraying toxic masculinity in the film. Shahid Kapoor who plays the lead character, opens up about this.
data.text:
Though Arjun Reddy was a massive blockbuster at the box office, it drew flak for glorifying the lead's obsessiveness with his girlfriend. The trailer of the remake of the film, Kabir Singh, hit the screens yesterday. Shahid's character wasn't entirely too different from Vijay Deverakonda's portrayal of the same character.

At the trailer launch of the film, Shahid responded to the criticism and said, "Sometimes we are very hypocritical about how we tend to look at cinema made in India. We then watch things made internationally and praise them for the fact that they are so honest, straight and not trying to be politically correct all the time.Cinema is not about perfect people. We all are imperfect in our own ways. Watching a film like Kabir Singh will help you understand that when you allow yourself to be affected by anger and negative emotions, it can take you on the path of destruction. The film warns you against going down that route."

advertisement

Shahid also added that cinema cannot limit itself to feel-good stories. "If we only want to watch happy characters, then cinema won't go far. We need to be able to make real films. If I start justifying each character, I can't be an actor," he added.

Kabir Singh has been directed by Sandeep Vanga, who had also helmed the Telugu film. Kabir Singh features Kiara Advani as the love interest.

It tells the story of a medical student who takes to alcoholism after a bitter break-up with his girlfriend. It will hit the screens on June 21. This is not the first time that Shahid has dealt with the subject of substance abuse. In Udta Punjab, he played the role of Tommy Singh, a rockstar who was also a drug addict.
